intro: Helictotrichon romeroizarcoi, commonly known as the Romeroizarcoi needlegrass, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and narrow, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its ecological role includes providing forage for wildlife and stabilizing soil in its native range.
